location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant James Tronson, Commander of the HC Brig Euphrates, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: James Tronson refers to his earlier letter, no. 17 of 1850 (see the previous item in this file). He states that the fishermen on Seir Abomeid [Şīr Bū Nu‘ayr], who belong to Shargah [Sharjah] and Bahrein [Bahrain], informed him that the Sheik [Sheikh Said bin Tahnun Al Nahayan] of Abothabee [Abu Dhabi] is well aware of the proceedings of the pirate, Saheil ben Atish, and that he [Saheil ben Atish] is frequently seen at Abothabee, although the Sheik says he has not been there for three years.
